main event: A witness sighted a bright, silver object the size of a saucer that would move and then remain stationary in the sky over Dayton, Ohio on May 18, 1960.
interesting points: The object's light appeared to go on and off four or five times before it disappeared.
The object remained visible for 5-7 minutes.
The report notes that the object moved, then remained stationary, then moved again, repeating this behavior.
The report states there was no moonlight and very few stars visible at the time.
The report concludes that the sighting was likely an aircraft, possibly a plane or helicopter, due to the inconsistencies in the witness report.
result: Insufficient data for evaluation, likely aircraft
